name: Mississippi
hint: The second-longest river in North America, flowing south through the central United States to the Gulf of Mexico

name: Missouri
hint: The longest river in North America, a major tributary of the Mississippi, flowing from Montana

name: Colorado
hint: A major river of the American Southwest, carving the Grand Canyon on its way to the Gulf of California

name: Rio Grande
hint: A major river forming much of the US-Mexico border, known as Rio Bravo in Mexico

name: Columbia
hint: The largest river in the Pacific Northwest, flowing from British Columbia through Washington and Oregon

name: St. Lawrence
hint: A major river connecting the Great Lakes to the Atlantic Ocean, flowing through Quebec, Canada

name: Yukon
hint: A major river flowing through Canada's Yukon Territory and Alaska to the Bering Sea

name: Ohio
hint: A major tributary of the Mississippi, flowing along the borders of several eastern US states

name: Arkansas
hint: A major tributary of the Mississippi, originating near Leadville, Colorado and flowing through Kansas and Oklahoma

name: Mackenzie
hint: Canada's longest river system, flowing north through the Northwest Territories to the Arctic Ocean
